lexUnit.name: sick.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: feeling nauseous and wanting to vomit.

sentence.text: It smears my file , and I feel sick every time I look at it .
I felt physically sick all the time and unable to eat but I was able to keep going .
He slumped across him , breathing heavily , feeling a little sick .
` They 're probably feeling a bit sick , " said a police spokesman .
She felt so sick that it was lunchtime before she could drag herself out of bed and come downstairs .
Feeling quite sick already , Flavia undid the scrap .
She felt sick all the time because of the baby , and she ate nothing .
I started to feel really sick then .
I 've felt sick every morning since Sunday . "
Celia felt slightly sick .
The sound of the door opening and of voices as people came out on to the deck shocked her so much that she felt physically sick .
Everytime , I thought about it , I felt physically sick and my stomach knotted …
She was sick when she ate certain foods , notably fish .
He kept being sick when I fed him . "
` He was sick when we came , " Carrie said .
Some puppies seem to be sick no matter what you do or how soon you accustom them to the car .
It refers to the fable of the sick lion and the wary fox , who is frightened at seeing all the footprints pointing towards the den and none the other way .
It makes even more precise the ability to spot a sick baby .
First-time heroin users may be sick .
Certainly until John got sick his Dad more or less avoided the bedroom .
He says he 's really sick and feverish .
